title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 20 October 2008 - XWiki
content:
xwikibot - (20/10/2008 08:51): Main.ReleaseNotes was modified by XWiki.jvelociter (Added XWiki Workspaces 1.1.1) - http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/ReleaseNotes  
xwikibot - (20/10/2008 08:55): Main.ReleaseNotesWorkspaces111 was modified by XWiki.jvelociter (Created the release notes for XWS 1.1.1) - http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/ReleaseNotesWorkspaces111  
xwikibot - (20/10/2008 08:56): Main.ReleaseNotesWorkspaces111 was modified by XWiki.jvelociter (Corrected link to full release notes) - http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/ReleaseNotesWorkspaces111

xwikibot - (20/10/2008 13:17): XWiki.XWikiCommittersGroup was modified by xwiki:XWiki.jvelociter - http://sandbox.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/XWiki/XWikiCommittersGroup  
xwikibot - (20/10/2008 13:18): XWiki.XWikiCommittersGroup was modified by XWiki.jvelociter (Added object) - http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/XWiki/XWikiCommittersGroup  
xwikibot - (20/10/2008 13:18): XWiki.XWikiCommittersGroup was modified by XWiki.jvelociter (Added Farouk Korteby as a sandbox commiter) - http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/XWiki/XWikiCommittersGroup  
xwikibot - (20/10/2008 13:20): XWiki.fkorteby was modified by XWiki.fkorteby (Created user) - http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/XWiki/fkorteby  
xwikibot - (20/10/2008 13:32): Main.Roadmap was modified by xwiki:XWiki.jvelociter - http://workspaces.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/Roadmap  
phreeza - (20/10/2008 14:07): hi all, i'm trying to make my own property type using groovy. I want to extended DBList. I've made extensions of the DBList and DBMetaList classes. now can i  have to "register" this   
phreeza - (20/10/2008 14:07): oops  
phreeza - (20/10/2008 14:08): do i have to register the property somewhere to make it show up?  
jvelociter - (20/10/2008 14:23): phreeza: Hi. Yes I think you have to patch the core to do this right now  
phreeza - (20/10/2008 14:26): jvelociter: hm... ok. that is what i was trying to avoid... any idea where i would have to look?  
jvelociter - (20/10/2008 14:28): yes, unfortunately you don't have much choice. We will surely improve that but it will not happen very soon. I think first you need to have your property mapped in the xwiki.hbm.xml file  
jvelociter - (20/10/2008 14:29): (phreeza: )  
jvelociter - (20/10/2008 14:29): I don't know that part of the core very well, but you should take a look at classes under com.xpn.xwiki.objects in xwiki-core  
phreeza - (20/10/2008 14:31): jvelociter: ok thanks i will look there. it is mapped already, i'm just missing the displaying of the property when editing the class...  
jvelociter - (20/10/2008 14:31): phreeza: then maybe you just miss a modification in the object editor velocity template  
jvelociter - (20/10/2008 14:31): let me look...  
jvelociter - (20/10/2008 14:33): phreeza http://fisheye2.atlassian.com/browse/~raw,r=11508/xwiki/platform/web/trunk/standard/src/main/webapp/templates/editobject.vm  
jvelociter - (20/10/2008 14:33): this is the template that displays the object editing UI  
jvelociter - (20/10/2008 14:33): phreeza: oups, actually I am wrong, this is not the place you are looking for  
jvelociter - (20/10/2008 14:34): it's a panel in fact  
phreeza - (20/10/2008 14:34): ah yes, it is a dropdown in a panel  
phreeza - (20/10/2008 14:36): ah ok i think i'm getting it  
phreeza - (20/10/2008 14:36): #foreach($prop in $xwiki.metaclass.properties) looks like i have to ad it there  
jvelociter - (20/10/2008 14:37): yes, in Panels/AddObject?editor=object  
jvelociter - (20/10/2008 14:37): maybe you can hardcode/add your prop in the list  
phreeza - (20/10/2008 14:39): jvelociter, yea i think i am about to figure it out. thanks for your help. i'm going to lunch now then i will look further  
phreeza - (20/10/2008 14:39): http://svn.xwiki.org/svnroot/xwiki/platform/core/trunk/xwiki-core/src/main/java/com/xpn/xwiki/objects/meta/MetaClass.java  
phreeza - (20/10/2008 14:40): that's what i hava to modify  
jvelociter - (20/10/2008 14:40): ok phreeza, have fun with it :)  
xwikibot - (20/10/2008 14:44): Applications.MonitoringApplicationDownloads was modified by xwiki:XWiki.jbousque (Added comment) - http://code.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Applications/MonitoringApplicationDownloads  
jvelociter - (20/10/2008 15:12): jvdrean: Salut  
jvelociter - (20/10/2008 15:13): The trashbin says you've deleted this page : http://code.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Applications/AdminApplicationDownloads/  
jvelociter - (20/10/2008 15:13): was that on purpose ?  
jvelociter - (20/10/2008 15:15): oh ok, I understand  
jvelociter - (20/10/2008 15:15): it has been renamed  
xwikibot - (20/10/2008 15:15): Applications.MonitoringApplicationDownloads was modified by xwiki:XWiki.jvelociter - http://code.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Applications/MonitoringApplicationDownloads  
xwikibot - (20/10/2008 15:16): Applications.MonitoringApplicationDownloads was modified by xwiki:XWiki.jvelociter (Added comment) - http://code.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Applications/MonitoringApplicationDownloads  
xwikibot - (20/10/2008 15:58): AdminGuide.Installation was modified by xwiki:XWiki.NatoIne (Added comment) - http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/AdminGuide/Installation  
xwikibot - (20/10/2008 16:07): Main.WebHome was modified by xwiki:XWiki.RaffaelloPelagalli (Added comment) - http://skol.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/  
phreeza - (20/10/2008 16:32): i have a dumb question... how do i print something to the page from a groovy script?  
phreeza - (20/10/2008 16:33): oh haha got it, never mind  
phreeza - (20/10/2008 18:20): what version of groovy does the current release of xwiki use?  
vmassol - (20/10/2008 18:33): phreeza: an old version right now... groovy-all-1.0-jsr-06  
vmassol - (20/10/2008 18:33): we're planning to upgrade to a newer version soon though  
vmassol - (20/10/2008 18:34): (soon = before end of the year)  
phreeza - (20/10/2008 18:37): vmassol: ah ok. that would be great. I'm trying to map an existing database with relations to the xwiki classes.... preferably only using scripting from the runtime, not patching or writing plugins. it is more difficult than i thought. I understand that from groovy 1.1 it is possible to dynamically change existing methods which would allow me to mod the DBList property for my needs  
phreeza - (20/10/2008 18:38): which would be a pretty hacky solution but i don't really care as long as it is written in the wiki and not a patch  
vmassol - (20/10/2008 18:44): phreeza: yeah that would be hacky ;)  
vmassol - (20/10/2008 18:44): phreeza: we're slowly migrating the whole xwiki to components so it'll be possible to modify all parts of xwiki more easily in the future  
xwikibot - (20/10/2008 19:37): XWiki.KumarKarthik was modified by XWiki.KumarKarthik (Created user) - http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/XWiki/KumarKarthik
